. When appointed by Bill Clinton as commerce secretary, none other than Donald Rumsfeld spoke favorably at Daley's confirmation hearing. Daley was mildly but publicly critical of Barack Obama 's health care reform strategy. He argued last year: We've really got to listen carefully to the public. Voters are not re-embracing conservative ideology. But we must acknowledge that the left's agenda has not won the support of a majority of Americans-- and, based on that recognition, we must steer a more moderate course. Barack Obama has put into place a staff structure that would allow for a shift toward the center-left.
